intro: Thesium coarctiflorum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered thesium, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their grass-like appearance. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or green. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
